intro: Myrmecodia schlechteri subsp. kopiagoensis, commonly known as the Kopiagoensis Cephalopod, is a unique epiphytic plant native to the rainforests of Borneo. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, swollen, and often brightly colored pseudobulbs. The plant forms a symbiotic relationship with ants, which reside in the hollow stems and provide protection against herbivores.
